metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12652 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
libpng before 1.6.32 does not properly check the length of chunks against the user limit.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-12652` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 73.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 73.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 73.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libpng-tools - 1.6.37-1
libpng16-16 - 1.6.37-1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '73.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
libpng1.6 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.37-1').
thunderbird package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:68.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
